absolute ownership.definition: ownership esp. by a single person that is free of any encumbrances or limitations other than statutory law compareat

os·ten·si·ble ownership.definition: [Ä -sten-sə-bəl]ownership that is apparent rather than actual and that sometimes is recognized in cases of purchase of the property by an innocent third party [a dispute arising from the dealer'sand sale of the collateral]
os·ten·si·ble ownership.note: A purchaser from a person with ostensible ownership of property may be able to defeat the claim to the property of the actual owner who created the ostensible ownership.

ownership in in·di·vi·sion.definition: ownership by two or more persons each having undivided shares in the property as a whole compareat
ownership in in·di·vi·sion.note: Ownership in indivision is ended by a partition of the property.

qualified ownership.definition: ownership that is limited by time, the interest of another party, or restrictions on the use of the property [had onlyof the fish and game on his property due to state restrictions]
qualified ownership.qualified ownership: of the fish and game on his property due to state restrictions]
